snippet: As a presidential candidate, George H.W. Bush was seen as an awkwardly disconnected, wealthy Republican who struggled to earn the trust of conservatives in his party.
abstract: As a presidential candidate, George H.W. Bush was seen as an awkwardly disconnected, wealthy Republican who struggled to earn the trust of conservatives in his party.

headline.main: The Parallels Between Mitt Romney and George H.W. Bush
headline.print_headline: Romney Hears Echoes of a Bush’s Struggle
